Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in determining that applicants were not Convention refugees or persons in need of protection
Application_Facts: Applicants claimed past persecution due to ethnicity and imputed political opinion
Decision_Outcome: The Boardâ€™s decision was reasonable and did not warrant judicial intervention
Court_Ruling: Application for judicial review dismissed; no question certified
Legal_Standard: Fear of persecution based on enumerated grounds under IRPA
Assessment_Factor: Changed country conditions in Mauritania reducing future risk
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review application under IRPA challenging the Board's rejection
Review_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to Board's decision
Evidence_Used: Discrimination but not persecution found by the Board
Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA provisions on refugee status and need for protection
Application_Basis: Claim of past persecution and fear of future harm
Evidence_Assessed: Nature and severity of discrimination, current conditions in Mauritania
Relief_Sought: Grant of refugee status or protection
Governing_Rule: Under IRPA, refugee status requires fear of persecution based on enumerated grounds; changed country conditions may negate claim unless compelling reasons exist
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Insufficient evidence to establish persecution rather than discrimination
Harm_Assessment: Risk of harm assessed as low due to changed conditions in country of origin
Cause_Description: Applicants fled Mauritania citing ethnic discrimination and political persecution
Evidence_Handling: Board evaluated evidence of past treatment and country conditions
Legal_Provision: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act - Refugee and protection provisions
Evidence_Assessment: Board found discrimination but not persecution; considered updated country information
Decision_Rationale: No error in Board's assessment that applicants did not meet the definition of Convention refugee or person in need of protection
Legal_Standard_Applied: Objective basis for fear of persecution under IRPA
